intro: Psychotria synactica, commonly known as the red-eyed wonder, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red bracts that enclose small, white flowers, making it visually distinctive. It typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Psychotria synactica is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
